Description: Creates a new project, configuration file, or solution based on the specified template.
Builds a project and all of its dependencies.
Runs source code without any explicit compile or launch commands.
Runs unit tests using the test runner specified in the project.
Packs the application and its dependencies into a folder for deployment to a hosting system.
Creates a NuGet package of your code.
Restores the dependencies and tools of a project.
Cleans the output of the previous build.
Modifies a .NET solution file.
Adds a package or reference to a .NET project.
Removes a package or reference from a .NET project.
Lists project and solution references, installed SDKs, and runtimes.
Provides additional NuGet commands.
Installs, uninstalls, and manages .NET tools.
Formats code to match the .NET coding style.
Migrates a project.json-based project to a .csproj-based project.
Provides access to the MSBuild command-line interface.
Starts F# Interactive.
Runs a .NET Core CLI command when source files change.
Manages HTTPS development certificates.
Manages user secrets for a project.
Creates and manages SQL Server-based distributed cache.
Entity Framework Core CLI commands.
Prints out detailed information about the .NET installation and the machine environment.
Prints out the version of the .NET SDK used by dotnet commands.
Prints out a list of the installed .NET runtimes.
Prints out a list of the installed .NET SDKs.
